title: Towers should destroy traps if no enemy minions are there.
body:
Why would a tower not disarm an enemy trap if it has nothing else to shoot at? It just makes sense that it would.

_Edit: Just for clarity, you would not be able to juggle aggro by placing traps. Traps would have a lower priority than champions and minions so they would only be targeted if the tower literally had nothing else to shoot at._

Or we could design it smarter and cause it to swap aggro the way it does when champion attacks you under your turret. Note he doesn't say initially the tower must shoot but that it disarms the trap, thus the delay would be insignificant.

The issue is - and this is what they're saying - if you time it well, the turret is already shooting at the trap when the minions walk into range, so even if it switches aggro to a minion immediately, it's just attacked and needs to wait to shoot again - delaying the first shot against minions no matter what.

Now, there are still alternatives to this, of course - the trap disarm could, say, use a different effect/ability/animation that only occurs when the tower has nothing to shoot in range, but isn't the normal attack - so that it shoots at minions immediately again when they walk back into range.

OP never said the towers should shoot the traps, just said they should disarm them when no other target is nearby.

I used both actually. Destroy in the title while disarm and "shoot at" are in the description. I was not entirely sure what would be more balanced / fair. On one side, destroying would render the ability useless unless actively sieging a tower with a wave, but once the wave is gone, the traps would be destroyed, thus loosing their pressure and some of their value, it also would makes their usually longer cooldown a bit less justified. On the other hand, if they were only disabled, the pressure would only temporarily be disabled, but it would become much more confusing and harder for defenders to time when traps will reactivate, despawn, and/or deactivate. Not to mention it is one more thing to pay attention to on both sides. 

I am leaning more towards destroy though, since disarming more or less is the same as it is now. Currently traps under towers are revealed if hidden, and can be cleared by players. They also tend to be more useless then beneficial if no enemies are nearby to utilize them when they go off (unless you are Caitlyn and get the range increase for a headshot).
